title: go.tools/importer: handling of print builtins inconsistent with gc
body:
The importer package has a couple of inconsistencies with how print/println work in gc:
 - Static type information is lost
 - Nilary print()/println() cause a panic

The nilary problem is a simple bug and trivial to fix. The type loss issue is
problematic for llgo; I want to generate the same output as gc, and this is preventing
that.
